steps.title: Task Completion & Progress Tracking
details: User lands on home page successfully.
Tries to mark a task complete – checkbox cannot be located (Step 3 ❌).
Down-stream checks for progress bar, badge, screenshots never run (Steps 4-8 🛑).

steps.title: PWA Installation & Offline Use
details: Homepage opens and the script waits for install banner.
Banner never surfaces; tester cannot accept it (Step 3 ❌).
All later offline-mode steps are skipped.

steps.title: Theme & UI Customisation
details: User looks for Dark-mode toggle – element not found (Step 3 ❌).
All subsequent theme/glow checks are abandoned.

steps.title: Data Import & Export
details: User attempts to click “Select JSON file” – click repeatedly intercepted by overlay label (Step 3 ❌).

steps.title: Task Creation Flow
details: Add-task screen opens; form fields visible.
User submits empty form – expects inline errors.
Validation appears for Task-Name but NOT for Task-Description (Step 4 ❌).
Rest of creation flow never executed.

steps.title: Task Sharing & Import
details: Attempting to click “Add Task” to create a sharable item – button is unstable/not clickable (Step 3 ❌).

emotional_arc: Starts hopeful—core pages load quickly. Confidence dips each time an expected control (checkbox, install prompt, dark-mode toggle, upload button, Add-task click) is missing or unresponsive. Repeated dead-ends create mounting frustration and distrust in reliability. By the final scenario the shopper would likely abandon or assume the app is broken.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users cannot complete primary jobs (complete task, toggle theme, start import, share) if controls are hidden, mislabeled or overlapped.
next_actions: Audit DOM & CSS for hidden/overlapping elements (e.g., checkbox, Add-Task, JSON upload).
Add explicit labels/ARIA roles and larger hit areas.
Provide empty-state hints (e.g., “No tasks yet – create one to try completion”).

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast and inconsistent fonts/padding hamper legibility and perceived polish.
next_actions: Run automatic a11y/contrast checks; adopt WCAG-compliant palette.
Define a type scale and spacing tokens in the design system; apply across pages.
Re-test with real content and longer labels.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Missing or partial error messages leave users confused about what is required.
next_actions: Ensure every required field returns a visible, consistent error on submit.
Keep error copy concise and contextual (e.g., ‘Description is required’).
Unit-test form edge cases (blank, invalid formats).

qualitative_opportunities.area: Progressive Web App prompts & install path
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: If install banner never triggers, users won’t know PWA is available; hurts engagement.
next_actions: Validate service-worker registration and correct ‘beforeinstallprompt’ handling.
Offer an in-app ‘Install App’ button as backup.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Primary productivity feature; click interception stops flow.
next_actions: Support drag-and-drop & clipboard equally, with empty-state guidance.
Show spinner + success toast after import.

first_tackles.description: Fix element overlap/instability that blocks clicks on Checkbox, Add-Task and File-Upload – immediate unblock of core actions.
Implement comprehensive, visible validation messages for all form fields.
Improve color contrast & font sizing to meet WCAG AA – quick CSS pass boosts readability and trust.
Add explicit ‘Install App’ button; validate PWA prompt firing.
Introduce empty-state messages that guide first-time users (e.g., no tasks, no imports).
